core.planner
Interface Term

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Standardizable, Substituable
All Known Implementing Classes:
Constant, Function, Variable
public interface Term
extends Standardizable, Substituable, java.lang.Cloneable

The Term class implements a term. A term is either a variable a symbol, a constant, or an expression of either of the form: (list t1 t2 ... tn) or (f t1 t2 ... tn) where f is a function symbol and each ti is a term. Also a call-term is an expression of the form: (call f t1 t2 ... tn) where f is the name of the attached procedure and each ti is a term or a call-term. The Term class implements these two definitions. The Term class has some flags that identify whether its content is a constant, a variable, a function or a call-term.

unify

Substitution unify(Term t)
                   throws UnificationException
Returns the most general unifier of two terms.

Parameters:
t - the Term to unify.
Returns:
the most general unifier or null if it does not exist. An empty mgu means that there is no binding Variable between t and this term.
Throws:
UnificationException - if t is not an instance of Term.

unify

Substitution unify(Term t,
                   Substitution alpha)
                   throws UnificationException
Returns the most general unifier of two terms. Prior binding variables contained in the Substitution parameter are considered.

Parameters:
t - the Term to unify.
alpha - the prior binding variables.
Returns:
the most general unifier or null if it does not exist. An empty mgu means that there is no binding Variable between t and this term.
Throws:
UnificationException - if t is not an instance of Term.
